clinicalDescription: Overview: Group of conditions, diseases, and disorders that affect the blood vessels and blood supply to the brain, can be temporary or permanent. Disease headings = stroke (most common), transient ischemic attack (TIA), aneurysms, vascular malformations, vascular dementia, subarachnoid hemorrhage. When occurs suddenly = cerebrovascular accident (CVA)Presentation: stroke - facial droop, arm weakness, speech difficulty. headache, vertigo, N/V, confusion, arm/leg/face numbness, difficult to walk Assessment: Histpry & physical, angiogram, ultrasound, CT, EEG, lumbar puncture, MRI Plan: Depends on the type of cerebrovascular disease. lifestyle changes. Meds = BP and chol-lowering meds, and anticoagulants, diuretics, ACE inhibitors, beta blockers, statinsPrognosis: Many peole return to normal function. Stroke needs immediate medical attention. Can be left with permanent disabilities.
